results.name: a(n) = n^2 - 3.
comment: Essentially the same as A028872 (n^2-3 with offset 2).

a(n) is the constant term of the quadratic factor of the characteristic polynomial of the 5 X 5 tridiagonal matrix M_n with M_n(i,j) = n for i = j, M_n(i,j) = -1 for i = j+1 and i = j-1, M_n(i,j) = 0 otherwise.
The characteristic polynomial of M_n is (x-(n-1))*(x-n)*(x-(n+1))*(x^2-2*n*x+c) with c = n^2-3.
The characteristic polynomials are related to chromatic polynomials, cf. links. They have roots n+sqrt(3).
link: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (3,-3,1).
example: The quadratic factors of the characteristic polynomials of M_n for n = 1..6 are
program: (MAGMA) mat:=func< n | Matrix(IntegerRing(), 5, 5, [< i, j, i eq j select n else (i eq j+1 or i eq j-1) select -1 else 0 > : i, j in [1..5] ]) >; [ Coefficients(Factorization(CharacteristicPolynomial(mat(n)))[4][1])[1]:n in [1..50] ]; // _Klaus Brockhaus_, Nov 13 2010
